Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Initial Appearance as to Elving Madera-Rivera, Jose Rivera-Ramirez, Noel Acevedo-Rosado, Raul Alemany-Minguela, Alexis Pinzon-Galindo, Agatha Casanova- Matias, Llamilet Seda-Ortiz, Dacmarie Davila-Marrero, Juan Luis Cardona-Cruz, Wilson Martinez-Troche, Mayra Enid Miranda-Casiano, Shenary Torres-Morales held on 6/27/2013. Defendants were provided with copy of the indictment and advised as to the charges and their rights. After reviewing the CJA-23's filed by defendants, the Court ordered the appointment of attorneys for each defendant. Arraignment/Detention set for 7/2/2013 at 09:00 AM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Defendants are ordered detained pending hearings. (yr) (Entered: 06/28/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Jose Rivera-Ramirez (4) Count 1 held on 7/2/2013. Present were AUSA Carlos Cardona and Ms. Mariangela Tirado. Dft is present and under custody. Defendant was found competent at this time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to the sole count. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail Ms. Tirado stated for the record that defendant's family did not have the means to post any bail. Sidebar held. Ms. Tirado reaffirmed that at this time they had nothing to offer, but reserved the right to reopen hearing. The Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:03.Hearing ended at 10:07.Interpreter -Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 07/10/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Noel Acevedo-Rosado (5) Count 1 held on 7/2/2013. Present were AUSA Carlos Cardona and Mr. Jason Gonzalez. Dft is present and under custody. Defendant was found competent atthis time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to the sole count. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, arguments heard. The Government opposing bail and Mr. Delgado offering bail conditions. After hearing the arguments, the Court ordered defendant detained without bail. Order to issue. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:02.Hearing ended at 10:13.Interpreter -Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 07/10/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Arraignment/Detention as to Alexis Pinzon-Galindo (8) Count 1 held on 7/2/2013. Present were AUSA Carlos Cardona and Mr. Jose Romo-Matienzo. Dft is present and under custody. Defendant was found competent atthis time to understand the proceedings. He waived the reading of the Indictment and entered a plea of not guilty as to the sole count. The parties will have 7 days for discovery and 14 days thereafter to  file any motions. Case is referred to Judge Cerezo for scheduling. As to bail, the Government did not oppose the recommendation of bail made by PT. Mr. Romo offered defendant's father's signature to secure bond. Bail was set in the amount of $5,000.00 unsecured with defendant's father's signature, UA and/or treatment, plus all other standard conditions of release. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 10:14.Hearing ended at 10:22.Interpreter -Sonia Crescioni. (yr) (Entered: 07/10/2013)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll: Bail Review Hearing as to Jose Oliveras held on 10/30/2013. AUSA Carlos Cardona  and defense counsel Joseph Laws were present. Defense counsel proffered that relatives were in court, defendant's grandmother is willing to post her property to guarantee bail and requested that bond be set. The Government was heard by proffer and requested, that if bond is granted to defense, that defendant wears an electronic monitoring device. The Court advised defendant's father of his responsibilities as third party custodian. After hearing the parties, the Court set bond as to Jose Oliveras (3) in the amount of $25,000 secured and was granted ten (10) days to post the bond. Standard release conditions, work with father, curfew with electronic monitoring device, third party custodian of father, drug testing and treatment are all imposed. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Motion Hearing as to Elving Madera-Rivera held on 1/28/2014 re 212 Emergency MOTION for Hearing Reopening Bail filed by Elving Madera-Rivera. Present were AUSA Carlos Cardona and Ms Lara Castro-Ward. Defendant was present and under custody. The parties met prior to commencing hearing. Arguments heard and proffer made, as well as lists of witnesses, both for the Government and defendant. After hearing the arguments from the parties, the Court ruled that what they had in front of them was basically the same as in the original bail hearing, and that more was needed in order to reconsider the issue of bail. The Court also suggested to defense counsel to review the medical records received from MDC yesterday in order to ascertain whether medical treatment had been provided or not, and to give the Government a waiver so that they could go and talk to the physician who defense counsel is proffering has seen defendant's evaluations and is willing to give treatment. Further Motion Hearing set for 2/12/2014 at 01:30 PM in Courtroom 11 before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Motion Hearing as to Elving Madera-Rivera held on 3/11/2014 re 212 Emergency MOTION for Hearing Reopening Bail filed by Elving Madera-Rivera. Present were AUSA Carlos Cardona, Ms Lara Castro and Mr. Rafael Castro-Lang. Defendant was present and under custody. The parties met in chamber prior to commencing hearing and discussed the witnesses to be presented. Mr. Castro-Lang called to the witness stand Dr. Lidy Lopez-Morales as expert witness for the defense. The parties stipulated the qualifications as doctors of both Dr. Lidy Lopez-Morales as well as Dr. Abigail Lopez- de-Lasalle, who is the witness for the Government. Direct, cross, redirect and re-cross of dr. Lidy Lopez conducted. The witness was excused. Exhibit A - defendant's medical record at MDC - presented and admitted into evidence. After the lunch break, the parties met at sidebar and stipulated bail as to the defendant. Bail was set in the amount of $40,000.00 of which $20,000.00 are to be cash or secured and $20,000.00 unsecured with defendant's and his father's signature, mental health, UA and/or treatment, home incarceration with EM, plus all other standard conditions of release. The Court also ordered US Probation to monitor that defendant does receive medical treatment for his health conditions. Defense counsel is ordered to file an informative motion every 45 days regarding medical treatment defendant is receiving and his condition. Defendant will be released from custody once bail has been posted. (Court Reporter -FTR.)Hearing set for 09:00.Hearing held at 09:40.Hearing ended at 01:44 Interpreter -Felix Toledo. (yr) (Entered: 03/11/2014)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Silvia Carreno-Coll:  Change of Plea Hearing as to Francisco Colon-Soto (2) held on 3/26/2014. AUSA Ed Veronda and defense counsel Laura Maldonado were present. Defendant was present in court and under custody. Consent was approved, filed and made part of the record. The defendant was found competent to plea. The Magistrate Judge will recommend to the Court that the Plea of Guilty be accepted as to Count One (1) of the Indictment. The defendant is to remain under custody. The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. A report and recommendation will be issued. Defense counsel requested that defendant remain in the jurisdiction, if at all possible, since defendant is working in a supervisory capacity in the kitchen at MDC and enjoys his work. The Court will recommend to MDC that defendant has employment within the institution and is on a regular and daily basis and, if at all possible, he remain in the jurisdiction. Minutes will be notified to MDC and USMS. Sentencing Hearing set for 6/25/2014 04:15 PM in Courtroom 4 before Judge Carmen C. Cerezo. s/c: PO, USMS and MDC through e-mail. (Court Reporter FTR/bg.) The Court ordered the preparation of a presentence report. A report and recommendation will be issued. The defendant is found competent to understand the proceedings. He is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to count One (1) of the Indictment be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Cerezo. Defendant to remain under same conditions of release. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez- Rive:Change of Plea Hearing as to Elving Madera-Rivera (1) held on 5/29/2015. Present were AUSA Dina Avila and Ms Lara Castro. Dft was present and on bond. Waiver of JT and consent to proceed before a U. S. Magistrate Judge was filed and accepted in open court. The defendant is found competent to understand the proceedings. He is advised of the maximum penalties he's facing, his constitutional rights, consequences of waiving said rights and the applicable statutory guidelines. After hearing the parties, the Magistrate Judge will issue a Report and Recommendation to Judge Cerezo so that the guilty plea as to count One (1) of the Indictment - Straight plea - be accepted. The Court orders the preparation of the Pre-Sentence Report. Sentencing Hearing to be set by Judge Cerezo. Defendant's bail conditions were modified to allow him to work, so it's home detention with EM, plus all other conditions previously imposed. (E-mail to USPO) (Court Reporter -DCR.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 02:27.Hearing ended at 02:49 Interpreter -Felix Toledo. (yr) (Entered: 06/02/2015)

ORDER granting 565 Motion to Modify Conditions of Bail Release as to Elving Madera-Rivera (1). Home incarceration is changed to home detention with EM, and work condition is added.Signed by US Magistrate Judge Camille L. Velez-Rive on 5/29/2015. (yr) (Entered: 06/02/2015)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Initial Appearance re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Raul Alemany- Minguela (6) held on 2/25/2020. Present: AFPD Isabel Mattina on behalf of the defendant. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. Copy of ECF No. 935 was provided to the defendant. The defendant was advised of the alleged SRT violations and also of his rights, including his right to a preliminary hearing. After reviewing the CJA-23 form filed by the defendant, the Court deemed it appropriate to appoint counsel. CJA Counsel was appointed to represent the defendant. The Court ordered the defendant temporarily detained pending further proceedings. The defendant informed through counsel that he was being housed at Bayamon 705 and had been sleeping on the floor together with other defendants. The Court instructed the USMS to investigate this matter further and, to the extent possible, ensure that the defendant is provided with proper bedding materials. Minute Entry for proceedings held before US Magistrate Judge Marshal D. Morgan:Preliminary Revocation Hearing re 935 and 945 Supplemental Motions Notifying Further SRT Violations as to Raul Alemany-Minguela (6) held on 3/6/2020. Present: AUSA Jose Contreras, defense counsel Diego Alcala and USPO Abnel Albaladejo. The defendant was present, under custody and assisted by a certified court interpreter. The defendant filed a Waiver of Preliminary Hearing. The Court approved the waiver and found probable cause pursuant to Rules 5 and 32.1 of the Fed.R.Crim.P. The case was referred to U.S. Senior District Judge Daniel R. Dominguez for Final Revocation Hearing. Attorney Alcala argued for conditions of release pending the final hearing. The Government requested detention. After hearing the parties and conferring with the USPO, the Court granted the defense's request and ordered the defendant released under the same conditions previously imposed plus the following added conditions: (1) employment or education and (2) drug testing and treatment. The USPO was ordered to file a motion notifying SRT violations if the defendant had one (1) unexcused absence from the treatment program. The Court left to the discretion of the USPO the determination of what may constitute a legitimate excuse for a missed treatment session. Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release set for 6/4/2020 10:00 AM in Old San Juan Courtroom before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez. (Court Reporter DCR-Courtroom 6.)Hearing set for 01:30.Hearing held at 01:54.Hearing ended at 02:29. Interpreter Sonia Crescioni. (lod) (Entered: 03/06/2020)

Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Daniel R. Dominguez: Final Hearing re Revocation of Supervised Release as to Raul Alemany-Minguela (6) held on 8/20/2020. Present: AUSA Jose Contreras, Attorney Diego Alcala and USPO Karina Ortiz. Defendant was on supervised release and assisted by the court interpreter. The defendant waived his right to appear physically for this proceeding and agreed to proceed with the hearing via VTC. Statements in regards to sentence recommendation heard by the parties. After having heard the parties, the Court found that defendant violated the conditions of supervised release. Therefore, the supervised release term previously imposed was revoked. IMPR: Six (6) months; SRT: Four (4) years. Defendant was advised his right to appeal. All terms and conditions are specified in the judgment form. Defendant shall surrender to U.S. Marshal's office on 9/2/2020. (Court Reporter Lisa O'Brien.) Hearing set for 10:00. Hearing held at 10:05. Hearing ended at 10:52. Interpreter Ani Navarro. Minute Entry for proceedings held before Judge Pedro A. Delgado-Hernandez: Status Conference as to Elving Madera-Rivera (1) held via VTC on 5/6/2021. Present: AUSA Juan Carlos Reyes and Attorney Jennie Espada. Defense counsel stated that defendant is currently housed at FCI Butner, highlighted his medical needs, and noted that additional time is necessary to receive certain supporting documentation and present it to the court. The Government, for its part, highlighted that release in this case is not warranted, that defendant can receive proper medical attention at the institution, and that the appropriate avenue for defendant is injunctive relief against the Bureau of Prisons. The Court ordered that defense counsel file a motion within 7 days, that is, not later than 5/13/2021, to submit supporting documentation. The court will schedule a further hearing upon review of the supporting documentation. (Court Reporter Cindy Brown.) Hearing set for 03:00. Hearing held at 03:07. Hearing ended at 03:19. (vso) (Entered: 05/06/2021)
